content:
I was able to get in contact with boshen , and it looks like they're not completely against the idea -- but they're not sold just yet.

That said they've had some trouble in the past with wasm plugins (in swc), so I think we may need to show them newer tooling approaches/integration.

In the past they used wasm32-unknown-unknown + wasmer it looks like, and I don't think they've tried the newer "modern webassembly" P2 stack.

@Till Schneidereit

Support plugins in `@swc/wasm-*` 路 Issue #3934 路 swc-project/swc
Describe the feature The stories around supporting plugins in SWC (#3540) did not cover wasm host version of the SWC, namely @swc/wasm and @swc/wasm-web. Currently, wasm host version of SWC lacks o...
What I might do is set up a quick PoC for how this could work and see if they're interested in driving this, assuming they're into the idea
